Jim,

please klick...........

http://tinyurl.com/7xc7z

I am quite  pleasantly surprised that the tsuba was given an 
attribution of " mid edo Hoan " by the shinsa team headed by Hagihara 
sensei.
I recall we discussed this tsuba long time ago on this list that this 
is most likely  a Shoami on an average day or a Umetada ( or 
Myochin ) on a very very good day.

You mentioned briefly that it has something to do with the beveling 
of the guard which I don't quite understand. Can you elaborate on 
that ?

Thanks........

p.s.  Just found out from an old timer that it is indeed good luck to 
wear pink on shinsa day.
That guy in pink tee shirt submitted one of the highest point score 
tsuba !!

Milt
